page.title: 11Typical Burgess Hill Diet
page.content:
The record of a nine year old's daily food intake.
For breakfast I had toast. My brother had Weetabix, which is a cereal made of wheat, and we had tea to drink. Before I went to school I had a drink of Ribena, a cordial made out of blackcurrants. At lunch time I had school dinners, when we had a choice of mince or ravioli. Ravioli is an Italian dish made of pasta with meat inside. There were potatoes, carrots and peas and a drink of water. When I got home from school I had a drink of orange and a packet of crisps. For dinner we had mince pie, cabbage and potatoes, peas and gravy. For pudding we had chocolate cake and orange to drink. Before I went to bed I had another drink of blackcurrant.
